channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Destroying endangered species' habitat wouldn't count as 'harm' under proposed Trump rule
item.description: The Trump administration is reinterpreting a key word in the Endangered Species Act that could have big consequences for the habitats of species at ri...

item.title: As Trump's trade war continues, Canadian businesses evaluate relationship with U.S.
item.description: The trade war the U.S. is waging with countries around the world could reshape the global economy. NPR's Planet Money brings a dispatch from Canada.

item.title: U.S. stocks drop as Nvidia slides and the fog of Trump's trade war thickens
item.description: The S&P 500 sank 2.2% after falling as much as 3.3% earlier. Such an amount would have vied for one of its worst losses in years before the historic s...

item.title: Tariffs make sour grapes for American winemakers
item.description: American winemakers tell us why tariffs hurt their industry.

item.title: Stem cells to treat Parkinson's? Two small studies hint at success
item.description: Two new studies suggest that Parkinson's disease can potentially be treated with stem cells placed in a patient's brain.

item.title: US to hold talks on Ukraine with European allies
item.description: Donald Trump has repeatedly said he wants to broker a swift end to the ongoing conflict.

item.title: Memo shows U.S. can send migrants with no criminal record to Guantanamo
item.description: A government memo obtained by CBS News shows the Trump administration created broad rules outlining which migrants can be held at Guantanamo Bay​.

item.title: Could this faraway world be home to life?
item.description: Researchers studying planet K2-18b's atmosphere have detected signs of molecules which on Earth are only produced by simple organisms.

item.title: Much of Puerto Rico still without power after island-wide pre-Easter blackout
item.description: Crews were reported to be making progress restoring power to Puerto Rico after an island-wide blackout that affected the main international airport, s...

item.title: 3/13: CBS Morning News
item.description: Deadline to pass short-term bill to avoid government shutdown approaches; Astronauts' homecoming delayed again.

item.title: Italy's Meloni to meet Trump with weight of EU anxiety on her shoulders
item.description: Trump has lauded Italy's right-wing Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni as a "fantastic leader." Their affinity has put pressure on the EU flag-bearer as sh...

item.title: Police dig up underground shooting range, guns buried in field
item.description: Neighbors could not hear guns going off because of the depth of the range, police said.

item.title: Trump administration threatens Harvard with foreign student ban
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem accused the institution of "threatening national security".

item.title: Tennessee’s GOP leads the fight to deny public education to children without documents
Canada party leaders grilled in election debate on how to tackle Trump
item.description: Frontrunner Mark Carney was tested in Wednesday's French-language debate, the first of two match-ups before the 28 April election.

item.title: Tesla whistleblower wins latest legal battle against Elon Musk
item.description: Engineer Cristina Balan raised a safety concern about a design flaw which could affect the cars' braking in 2014.

item.title: How war, money and the quest for discovery entwined the US government and universities
item.description: The showdown between the Trump administration and Harvard University is spotlighting bare-knuckled politics and big dollar figures.

item.title: Maryland Sen. Van Hollen meets with El Salvador’s vice president in push for Abrego Garcia’s release
